titleInfo.title: Circus wagons being towed by elephants, Nashville, Tennessee, 1938 October 26

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Pictured: A big crowd gathered to watch the circus wagons being towed by elephants from Kayne Avenue toward Division Street traveling to the “Features Show” at Centennial Park on October 26th, 1938. This was the Al G Barnes and Sells-Floto Combined Circus presenting Ringling Bros. and Barunum & Bailey Stupendus New Features. The Broadway Viaduct is seen in the background. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
